approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: Create a portal/dashboard for V-KYC team leads to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit purposes.
project_goals: Provide easy access to V-KYC recordings for audit requirements.
Reduce dependency on IT for retrieving recordings.
approval_data.business_context: The V-KYC team currently relies on the IT data server team to provide recordings stored on the LTF ‘NFS(Network File System)’ server. This process is manual and time-consuming, especially for audit requirements.

requirements.description: A portal/dashboard should be created for accessing V-KYC recordings.
Access to the portal should be provided to the leads of VKYC process (TL & Process Manager).
All recordings of V-KYC shall be made available on this portal.
Recordings should be fetched as and when required.
Recordings should be searchable by LAN ID.
Recordings should be available date and month wise.
Users should be able to upload an Excel or text file with a list of LAN IDs (up to 50) to download recordings in bulk.
The system should trigger a backend API call to process the bulk download request.
Results of the bulk download should be displayed in a tabular format with a 'Download All' option.
The table should have pagination displaying only 10 records at a time.
Only 10 records at a time should be downloaded during bulk download.
The file upload should accept csv/txt files.

functional_requirements: User authentication and authorization for accessing the portal.
Filtering and sorting of recordings by date and month.
Bulk download functionality with file upload.
Display of download results in a tabular format.
API integration for backend processing of bulk download requests.
non_functional_requirements: Performance: The portal should load quickly and respond efficiently to user requests.
Security: Access to the portal and recordings should be secure and restricted to authorized users.
Usability: The portal should be user-friendly and easy to navigate.
Availability: The portal should be available during business hours.
success_criteria: The portal is successfully deployed and accessible to authorized users.
Users can easily search and retrieve V-KYC recordings.
The bulk download functionality works as expected.
The system meets audit requirements for accessing recordings.
Reduction in time taken to retrieve recordings.
constraints: Recordings are stored on the LTF ‘NFS(Network File System)’ server.
Limited access to the screen (only Team leaders)
File upload will be csv/txt file.
Bulk download limited to 50 LAN IDs per file.
assumptions: The existing network infrastructure is sufficient to support the portal.
The API for retrieving recordings is available and functional.
The necessary data is available on the NFS server.
Team leads and process managers have the required technical skills to use the portal.
risks: Technical issues with the API integration.
Performance issues due to large data volumes.
Data loss or corruption during the migration or retrieval process.

recommendations: Define specific performance metrics (e.g., page load time, search response time).
Detail the security measures to be implemented.
Include mockups or wireframes of the portal interface for better clarity.
Specify the data retention policy for the recordings.

identified_gaps: Detailed specifications for API integration are missing.
Specific security requirements are not fully defined.
Performance testing requirements are not defined.
Data retention policy is not defined.
recommendations_for_completion: Collaborate with the IT team to define the API integration details.
Consult with the security team to define security requirements.
Define performance testing scenarios and metrics.
